author: craigmcc
msg: Add the ability to check for stale connections in GenericDataSource.  This
is configured by setting one or both of the following properties:
* pingCommand - An SQL command that does *not* return a result set
* pingQuery - An SQL SELECT command that does return a result set
Prior to returning a connection, GenericDataSource will execute any ping
command and/or query you have configured.  If either throws an exception,
this connection is considered stale and is thrown away.
Add a debugging detail level property to GenericDataSource, and associated
log methods, so that the activity of the data source can be traced.
Modify the initialization of data sources to configure the data source's
log writer to write to the web application's output logs.
To configure the appropriate properties in struts-config.xml, you would do
something like this:
<data-source>
<set-property property="debug" value="5"/>
<set-property property="pingCommand" value="rollback"/>
</data-source>
Tested with PostgreSQL 7.0.3, using "rollback" as the ping command.
Patch partially based on submission from Ted Husted.

author: craigmcc
msg: Update the struts-config DTD (and the associated examples) to indicate
that <set-property> elements should be used to configure *all* properties
of any <data-source> element you provide.  This makes it easier to
substitute alternate data source implementations (the only Struts-based
requirment is that it must implement javax.sql.DataSource) and configure
it, with no dependencies on the struts-config DTD.
